channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Quantum computing stocks are sinking today: What’s happening with Rigetti, D-Wave, QUBT, and IonQ?
item.description: The fortunes of major quantum computing firms turned negative this week as share prices sank—in some cases by double digits. The so-called Quantum Fou...

item.title: Why Gen-Z Wants Employers to Pay for More Skills Training
item.description: A new study says younger workers are most vocal about getting companies to support their professional development.

item.title: Toonstar’s new ‘Uncle Roger’ cartoon embraces AI—but slop it’s not

item.title: AI is gobbling our personal data—but new advances in blockchain can stop that
item.description: Blockchain's growing ability to verify our identity and actions mean we don't have to rely on corporate AI tools.

item.title: How Lay’s Pulled Off Its Biggest Rebrand in Nearly 100 Years
item.description: The chip brand is building into its story rather than stripping it to parts.

item.title: Microsoft Is Warning That Russia and China Are Increasingly Using AI to Mount Cyberattacks on the U.S.
item.description: The Microsoft report says foreign adversaries are adopting new tactics to weaponize the internet as a tool for espionage.

item.title: Meta is hiring entry-level roles that pay up to $290,000 a year and require little prior experience
item.description: The $1.8 trillion tech giant is looking for software engineers, only requiring a bachelor’s degree and minimal working experience. They’re welcome job...

item.title: Investors Are Worried About Another Regional Banking Crisis
item.description: Regional bank stocks just had their worst day against the S&P 500 since Silicon Valley Bank collapsed.

item.title: Why is Bitcoin crashing? Crypto king sinks to four-month low as investors seek safety in gold
item.description: October is usually a month for innocent frights and fun scares, but for Bitcoin investors, this month has left many holding the token legitimately fea...

item.title: The Walmart Integration With ChatGPT Has 1 Glaring Problem
item.description: You can use ChatGPT to have almost anything delivered–except the thing you might want most.

item.title: I see dead people on Sora, and I’m conflicted about it

item.title: Jamie Dimon calls Zohran Mamdani’s movement ‘more Marxist than socialist,’ but he’s offering his help: ‘Get involved and grow up’

item.title: Private credit: what critics miss and what founders need to know
item.description: The critiques of private credit too often focus on headlines and hypotheticals, rather than on structure, incentives, and outcomes.

item.title: How leaders can learn bravery

item.title: Job hugging. Quiet cracking. Rage applying. Are these buzzwords helping — or hurting — the workplace?
item.description: I'm Aflac's head of HR and worked in the industry for over two decades, and I've never seen workplace terminology evolve this quickly.
